body:
Hi, friends,
can you please help me with this error? I'm trying to recall my information but, first of all, I can't retrieve any mesh from look up daylighting component. in fact, I sometimes have this problem and usually use original mesh. but now when I'm using original mesh I get this error.  thanks...
topic: solution exception: gradient color takes exactly 5 arguments(7 given)

replies.body: Hi farzane, Probably, the "gradientColor(...) method" of your LB LB is not equals to "gradientColor(...) method" of LB_Recolor Mesh. But I need the file to check. Could you share a gh file like this? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/l0-9MwVwNFFWtQ3DQcfPc68gEmJNTijggrJa4ULVx8jmRSJyA--nVecaqbJPo7iRdMSCvxeF08xuIaaWlaSjHufH4xko67ex/gh_test.png) Best  Antonello

Dear Antonello

before you respond to my question I removed honeybee and lady bug and installed from the scratch. now I have another issue with recalling annual simulation.

I randomly get this errors

solution exception: index out of range()

                        : attempted to divide by zero



I attached gh and annual analysis files 

I will appreciate if you can help me through...



Thanks,

Hi farzane, This issue is because you used "Honeybee_Generate Zone Test Points" with multiple surfaces instead of an honeybee zone. Only the second branch is right, thus if you select it your simulation should be fine. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/la2V-cBKompgavhSCNuSg0lZma2Im4Twh9gBZVZrLpR823I7FwjSLxNroYDsKTlsDlOIr0GyvARIqxZ0P-IcG7l-0AIYv1XE/01.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/la2V-cBKomql1gT22kdtS8-dBu9-wZ9wChJ-6uvpdU8-w0KEe9XNACjyNQ7BhgUmADFr9pKUoMGyZyEPbhQSosDpi8IeQi7g/02.png) I suggest that you use "Honeybee_Generate Zone Test Points" with a closed honeybee zone. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/la2V-cBKomrX0H14X9xVfZIEynW1qr642TMEO*KuOLUQa8zjmeSG1DZD8usZMWASmNpQKFYUgrshF7I2UxDM-rPkCR4UVWp5/01_b.png) Best Antonello

Dear Antonello

thanks a lot, it was really helpful...



Regards,

Farzane

Hi farzane,



I had the same issue. The problem was that I was using an outdated version of Ladybug (VER 0.0.63 AUG_10_2016).

Updating to VER 0.0.63 AUG_25_2016 solved the problem in my case.



Best,

Veronika

Hi Veronika,

In fact, I had an updated plug in. after reinstalling it was solved...



thanks,
